Group Properties Dialog Box

Requires: Base Development System (Windows)

Select File»New»Group in the Domain Account Manager to display this dialog box. You also can right-click a group entry in the group list and select New or Properties from the shortcut menu or double-click the group entry in the group list to display this dialog box.

Use this dialog box to configure existing groups in the domain or create new groups in the domain.

This dialog box includes the following components:

  • Group name—Specifies the name of the group.
  • Description—Describes the group.
  • Users not in group—Displays the members of the domain. Use the left arrow and right arrow buttons to add the user to or remove the user from a domain.
  • Users in group—Displays the members of the group. Use the left arrow and right arrow buttons to add the user to or remove the user from a group. By default, the built-in Guest is a member of the built-in Guests group in the domain. You cannot remove the Guest from the Guests group. The built-in Administrator is a member of the built-in Administrators group. You cannot remove the Administrator from the Administrators group.
